newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish banking group agreement possible next week.
newsitem.headline: Polish banking group agreement possible next week.

text.p: Poland's finance ministry on August 28 is likely to decide the final shape of an agreement to form a group of four state-owned banks, the deputy president of Bank Pekao SA, the group's planned leader, said on Friday.

"A meeting is planned for August 28 of the presidents of the banks of the group with deputy finance minister Ryszard Pazura. I hope that at that meeting we'll submit a text largely agreed on," Andrzej Dorosz told reporters.

He said that the four banks -- Pekao, Powszechny Bank Gospodarczy SA (PBG), Bank Depozytowo-Kredytowy SA (BDK) and Pomorski Bank Kredytowy SA w Szeczinie (PBKS) still remained divided over some details of the plan.
Dorosz said the finance ministry, which represents the state treasury as the banks' owner, would have to make the final decision if the banks failed to agree next week.
"The final decision always rests with the owner," he said.

All four banks have agreed to take part in the government's consolidation plan aimed to form a banking group led by the Warsaw-based Pekao SA, which would later be privatised, but remained divided over how the group would operate. -- Jacek Ramotowski +48 22 653 9700
